ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] More Thoughts and Questions . . .
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Suzanne! Thanks for the note. Do you mean Surefall Glade? If so that s where I m at right now in the game more or less. I m soulbound there anyway.
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Suzanne!

Thanks for the note. Do you mean Surefall Glade? If so
that's where I'm at right now in the game more or
less. I'm soulbound there anyway.
:o)

That could be an idea though, it is kind of a neat
place. I'm not sure how many people will even come to
something like this. I expect it to be small. I'm
fairly new to the game and don't know lots of people
yet. He has played for much longer but tends to be a
loner and solo a lot, at least before he ran into me.

It might be an idea though. Funny I was right there
and didn't even think of it. Of course, there are so
many places I haven't been yet.

As for guilds I sort of have this feeling that its a
bit tacky to go around asking. On the other hand I
really want to try that part of the game out.
Maybe I don't have enough escapades.
:o)

Hugs,
:o)
Brangvyne

--- "Suzanne J. Johnson" <katannah@...> wrote:
> There's a ranger haven on the mainland outside of
> Qeynos, IIRC. That's where I got married. The name
> escapes me (haven't played in a long while) but
> someone on the list should know of which I speak.
> It's very nice. If you have any concerns about
> guests' safety, ask some of your 'wedding party' to
> be 'ushers', ie., escort your guests from Qeynos.
> Or have a wizard 'port 'em in.
>
> My fiance and I were both rangers. We were very
> effective at taunting; once one'd take too much
> damage, the other would start taunting madly.
> 'Course, the roles may have changed in the past
> year...
>
> Guilds, eh... they're nice if you've joined one
> because you regularly adventure with many of its
> members, but I never personally advertised for a
> guild. I tended to let my escapades take me where
> they would (as an elven ranger when Povar was first
> new, there was A LOT of escapade) and ran into my
> guild brethren when hunting. When I began looking
> for them when I signed on, I knew I was finding a
> "home". Just my two coppers'.
>
> Best regards,
>
> Aelwesara Cuthalion, Ranger of Tunare
> Ertho Cuthalion!
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Brangvyne
> To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 1:19 PM
> Subject: [EQ_women] More Thoughts and Questions .
> . .
>
>
> Salutations All!
>
> I have not posted for a while, and I know everyone
> was probably
> relaxing a little and here I am again.
> :o)
>
> EQ has been progressing prettry good for me I
> think. I've made a
> couple of good friends who are more experienced
> then me and don't
> seem to mind giving advice or helping out so
> that's very nice.
>
> I've also been trying to learn more about my role
> as a Ranger in
> Norrath. I just found out last week what a handy
> thing taunt can be
> when trying to keep a mob off your healer? OK, I'm
> slow but I'm
> getting there I think. And I've gotten duel wield
> and double attack
> now so that's interesting to play with.
>
> Last night a Druid friend and I went to Paudal
> Cavern for my first
> trip there. I would have died twice during the
> first fight we had I
> think if they had not been there to keep me from
> deaths door. That
> was a tough mob and red all the way for me at lvl
> 19 (20 now).
>
> Anyway, enough ramblin, so it's question time:
>
> 1.) I have been asked to get married and have said
> yes. :o) Any good
> suggestions on locations that would be nice but
> not to hard for
> guests to get to? He has a place in mind, I forget
> the name, but it
> sounds like it might be hard for lower level
> characters to even
> reach. I have not traveled over much of Norrath
> still so I'm not
> sure. Anyway, if anyone has ideas I'd love to hear
> them.
> Also, when things are set, which may be a while
> I'll post a note here
> letting everyone know. You are all invited, of
> course, feel free to
> come if you have a character on the Xegony server,
> of if you want
> just create a quick one at the proper time and
> come anyway. I'd love
> to meet anyone who might do me the honor of
> coming.
>
> 2.) Can anyone give me advice on how to find a
> guild that might be
> interested in letting a Ranger in the low 20's
> join? Would it be ok
> to just kind of start asking around? Is there a
> way to tell a better
> guild from one not as good?
>
> Anyway, I hope everyone had a nice Thanksgiving.
>
> Hugs
> :o)
> Bran
> lvl 20 Wood Elf Ranger
>
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo!
> Terms of Service.
>
>
